alert.note: Alert for Aitkin; Crow Wing (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 12:43PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Crow Wing and Morrison Counties. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Crow Wing and Aitkin Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. .Warm temperatures last week caused rapid snowmelt from a deep snowpack. This resulted in strong increase river flows. Additional precipitation Thursday will extend the period of high water in the area. Snow is expected for northern tier basins while rainfall is expected to the south. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Aitkin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Pumping begins at the waste water treatment plant. Sandbagging begins at Aitkin city transformer. Water tops the levees on the North side of Aitkin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM CDT Thursday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.5 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.7 feet on 04/28/2001. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mississippi River Aitkin 13.0 16.6 Thu 11 am CD 17.1 17.4 17.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Friday evening by 630 PM CDT.
